info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, southwestern Berkshire, northeastern Dutchess and southeastern Columbia Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Copake, or 10 miles southwest of Great Barrington, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Amenia, Copake, Sheffield, Sharon, Austerlitz, Canaan, Millerton, Falls Village, Cornwall Bridge, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Salisbury, Hillsdale, Cornwall, Alford, South Canaan, Wangum Village, West Goshen and Skiff Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
